fields.name: DISFOLD
fields.description: Disables folding of IT instructions.

fields.name: FPEXCODIS
fields.description: Disables FPU exception outputs.

fields.name: DISRAMODE
fields.description: Disables dynamic read allocate mode for Write-Back Write-Allocate memory regions.

fields.name: DISITMATBFLUSH
fields.description: Disables ITM and DWT ATB flush.

enumeratedValues.name: DISITMATBFLUSH_1
enumeratedValues.description: ITM and DWT ATB flush disabled, this bit is always 1.

fields.name: DISBTACREAD
fields.description: Disables BTAC read.

enumeratedValues.name: DISBTACREAD_1
enumeratedValues.description: BTAC is not used and only static branch prediction can occur.

fields.name: DISBTACALLOC
fields.description: Disables BTAC allocate.

enumeratedValues.name: DISBTACALLOC_1
enumeratedValues.description: No new entries are allocated in Branch Target Address Cache (BTAC), but existing entries can be updated.

fields.name: DISCRITAXIRUR
fields.description: Disables critical AXI Read-Under-Read.

enumeratedValues.name: DISCRITAXIRUR_1
enumeratedValues.description: An AXI read to Strongly-Ordered or Device memory, or an LDREX to Shareable memory, is not put on AXI if there are any outstanding reads on AXI. Transactions on AXI cannot be interrupted. This bit might reduce the time that these transactions are in progress and might improve worst case interrupt latency. Performance is decreased when this bit is set.

fields.name: DISDI
fields.description: Disables dual-issued.

enumeratedValues.name: DISDI_1
enumeratedValues.description: Nothing can be dual-issued when this instruction type is in channel 0.

fields.name: DISISSCH1
fields.description: Disables dual-issued.

enumeratedValues.name: DISISSCH1_1
enumeratedValues.description: Nothing can be dual-issued when this instruction type is in channel 1.

fields.name: DISDYNADD
fields.description: Disables dynamic allocation of ADD and SUB instructions

enumeratedValues.name: DISDYNADD_0
enumeratedValues.description: Normal operation. Some ADD and SUB instrctions are resolved in EX1.

enumeratedValues.name: DISDYNADD_1
enumeratedValues.description: All ADD and SUB instructions are resolved in EX2.

fields.name: DISCRITAXIRUW
fields.description: Disables critical AXI read-under-write

enumeratedValues.name: DISCRITAXIRUW_0
enumeratedValues.description: Normal operation. This is backwards compatible with r0.

enumeratedValues.name: DISCRITAXIRUW_1
enumeratedValues.description: AXI reads to DEV/SO memory. Exclusive reads to Shareable memory are not initiated on the AXIM AR channel until all outstanding stores on AXI are complete.

fields.name: DISFPUISSOPT
fields.description: Disables critical AXI read-under-write

fields.name: REVISION
fields.description: Indicates patch release: 0x0 = Patch 0

fields.name: PARTNO
fields.description: Indicates part number

fields.name: ARCHITECTURE
fields.description: ARCHITECTURE

fields.name: VARIANT
fields.description: Indicates processor revision: 0x2 = Revision 2

fields.name: IMPLEMENTER
fields.description: Implementer code

fields.name: VECTACTIVE
fields.description: Active exception number

fields.name: RETTOBASE
fields.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

enumeratedValues.name: RETTOBASE_0
enumeratedValues.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute

enumeratedValues.name: RETTOBASE_1
enumeratedValues.description: there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

fields.name: VECTPENDING
fields.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

fields.name: ISRPENDING
fields.description: Interrupt pending flag, excluding NMI and Faults

fields.name: PENDSTCLR
fields.description: SysTick exception clear-pending bit

enumeratedValues.name: PENDSTCLR_1
enumeratedValues.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

fields.name: PENDSTSET
fields.description: SysTick exception set-pending bit

enumeratedValues.name: PENDSTSET_0
enumeratedValues.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

enumeratedValues.name: PENDSTSET_1
enumeratedValues.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

fields.name: PENDSVCLR
fields.description: PendSV clear-pending bit

enumeratedValues.name: PENDSVCLR_1
enumeratedValues.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

fields.name: PENDSVSET
fields.description: PendSV set-pending bit

enumeratedValues.name: PENDSVSET_0
enumeratedValues.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

enumeratedValues.name: PENDSVSET_1
enumeratedValues.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

fields.name: NMIPENDSET
fields.description: NMI set-pending bit

enumeratedValues.name: NMIPENDSET_0
enumeratedValues.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

enumeratedValues.name: NMIPENDSET_1
enumeratedValues.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

fields.name: TBLOFF
fields.description: Vector table base offset

registers.name: AIRCR
registers.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

fields.name: VECTRESET
fields.description: Writing 1 to this bit causes a local system reset

fields.name: VECTCLRACTIVE
fields.description: Writing 1 to this bit clears all active state information for fixed and configurable exceptions.

enumeratedValues.name: VECTCLRACTIVE_1
enumeratedValues.description: Clears all active state information for fixed and configurable exceptions

fields.name: SYSRESETREQ
fields.description: System reset request

enumeratedValues.name: SYSRESETREQ_1
enumeratedValues.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

fields.name: PRIGROUP
fields.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

fields.name: ENDIANNESS
fields.description: Data endianness

fields.name: VECTKEY
fields.description: Register key

fields.name: SLEEPONEXIT
fields.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

enumeratedValues.name: SLEEPONEXIT_0
enumeratedValues.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode

enumeratedValues.name: SLEEPONEXIT_1
enumeratedValues.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

fields.name: SLEEPDEEP
fields.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

fields.name: SEVONPEND
fields.description: Send Event on Pending bit

enumeratedValues.name: SEVONPEND_0
enumeratedValues.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

enumeratedValues.name: SEVONPEND_1
enumeratedValues.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

fields.name: NONBASETHRDENA
fields.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

enumeratedValues.name: NONBASETHRDENA_0
enumeratedValues.description: processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active

enumeratedValues.name: NONBASETHRDENA_1
enumeratedValues.description: processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

fields.name: USERSETMPEND
fields.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

fields.name: UNALIGN_TRP
fields.description: Enables unaligned access traps

enumeratedValues.name: UNALIGN_TRP_0
enumeratedValues.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

enumeratedValues.name: UNALIGN_TRP_1
enumeratedValues.description: trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

fields.name: DIV_0_TRP
fields.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

fields.name: BFHFNMIGN
fields.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

enumeratedValues.name: BFHFNMIGN_0
enumeratedValues.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up

enumeratedValues.name: BFHFNMIGN_1
enumeratedValues.description: handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

fields.name: STKALIGN
fields.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

fields.name: DC
fields.description: Enables L1 data cache.

fields.name: IC
fields.description: Enables L1 instruction cache.

fields.name: BP
fields.description: Always reads-as-one. It indicates branch prediction is enabled.

fields.name: PRI_4
fields.description: Priority of system handler 4, MemManage

fields.name: PRI_5
fields.description: Priority of system handler 5, BusFault

fields.name: PRI_6
fields.description: Priority of system handler 6, UsageFault

fields.name: PRI_11
fields.description: Priority of system handler 11, SVCall

fields.name: PRI_14
fields.description: Priority of system handler 14, PendSV

fields.name: PRI_15
fields.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

registers.name: SHCSR
registers.description: System Handler Control and State Register

fields.name: MEMFAULTACT
fields.description: MemManage exception active bit

fields.name: BUSFAULTACT
fields.description: BusFault exception active bit

fields.name: USGFAULTACT
fields.description: UsageFault exception active bit

fields.name: SVCALLACT
fields.description: SVCall active bit

fields.name: MONITORACT
fields.description: Debug monitor active bit

fields.name: PENDSVACT
fields.description: PendSV exception active bit

fields.name: SYSTICKACT
fields.description: SysTick exception active bit

fields.name: USGFAULTPENDED
fields.description: UsageFault exception pending bit

fields.name: MEMFAULTPENDED
fields.description: MemManage exception pending bit

fields.name: BUSFAULTPENDED
fields.description: BusFault exception pending bit

fields.name: SVCALLPENDED
fields.description: SVCall pending bit

fields.name: MEMFAULTENA
fields.description: MemManage enable bit

fields.name: BUSFAULTENA
fields.description: BusFault enable bit

fields.name: USGFAULTENA
fields.description: UsageFault enable bit

fields.name: IACCVIOL
fields.description: Instruction access violation flag

enumeratedValues.name: IACCVIOL_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor attempted an instruction fetch from a location that does not permit execution

fields.name: DACCVIOL
fields.description: Data access violation flag

enumeratedValues.name: DACCVIOL_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor attempted a load or store at a location that does not permit the operation

fields.name: MUNSTKERR
fields.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

enumeratedValues.name: MUNSTKERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more access violations

fields.name: MSTKERR
fields.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

enumeratedValues.name: MSTKERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more access violations

fields.name: MLSPERR
fields.description: MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValues.name: MLSPERR_0
enumeratedValues.description: No MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValues.name: MLSPERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: A MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

fields.name: MMARVALID
fields.description: MemManage Fault Address Register (MMFAR) valid flag

enumeratedValues.name: MMARVALID_0
enumeratedValues.description: value in MMAR is not a valid fault address

enumeratedValues.name: MMARVALID_1
enumeratedValues.description: MMAR holds a valid fault address

fields.name: IBUSERR
fields.description: Instruction bus error

fields.name: PRECISERR
fields.description: Precise data bus error

enumeratedValues.name: PRECISERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: a data bus error has occurred, and the PC value stacked for the exception return points to the instruction that caused the fault

fields.name: IMPRECISERR
fields.description: Imprecise data bus error

enumeratedValues.name: IMPRECISERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: a data bus error has occurred, but the return address in the stack frame is not related to the instruction that caused the error

fields.name: UNSTKERR
fields.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

enumeratedValues.name: UNSTKERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more BusFaults

fields.name: STKERR
fields.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

enumeratedValues.name: STKERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more BusFaults

fields.name: LSPERR
fields.description: Bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValues.name: LSPERR_0
enumeratedValues.description: No bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValues.name: LSPERR_1
enumeratedValues.description: A bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

fields.name: BFARVALID
fields.description: BusFault Address Register (BFAR) valid flag

enumeratedValues.name: BFARVALID_0
enumeratedValues.description: value in BFAR is not a valid fault address

enumeratedValues.name: BFARVALID_1
enumeratedValues.description: BFAR holds a valid fault address

fields.name: UNDEFINSTR
fields.description: Undefined instruction UsageFault

enumeratedValues.name: UNDEFINSTR_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor has attempted to execute an undefined instruction

fields.name: INVSTATE
fields.description: Invalid state UsageFault

enumeratedValues.name: INVSTATE_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor has attempted to execute an instruction that makes illegal use of the EPSR

fields.name: INVPC
fields.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, caused by an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

enumeratedValues.name: INVPC_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor has attempted an illegal load of EXC_RETURN to the PC

fields.name: NOCP
fields.description: No coprocessor UsageFault

enumeratedValues.name: NOCP_0
enumeratedValues.description: no UsageFault caused by attempting to access a coprocessor

enumeratedValues.name: NOCP_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor has attempted to access a coprocessor

fields.name: UNALIGNED
fields.description: Unaligned access UsageFault

enumeratedValues.name: UNALIGNED_0
enumeratedValues.description: no unaligned access fault, or unaligned access trapping not enabled

enumeratedValues.name: UNALIGNED_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor has made an unaligned memory access

fields.name: DIVBYZERO
fields.description: Divide by zero UsageFault

enumeratedValues.name: DIVBYZERO_0
enumeratedValues.description: no divide by zero fault, or divide by zero trapping not enabled

enumeratedValues.name: DIVBYZERO_1
enumeratedValues.description: the processor has executed an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

fields.name: VECTTBL
fields.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vector table read during exception processing.

enumeratedValues.name: VECTTBL_0
enumeratedValues.description: no BusFault on vector table read

fields.name: FORCED
fields.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handles, either because of priority or because it is disabled.

fields.name: DEBUGEVT
fields.description: Reserved for Debug use. When writing to the register you must write 0 to this bit, otherwise behavior is Unpredictable.

enumeratedValues.name: DEBUGEVT_1
enumeratedValues.description: Debug event has occurred. The Debug Fault Status Register has been updated.

fields.name: HALTED
fields.description: Indicates a debug event generated by either a C_HALT or C_STEP request, triggered by a write to the DHCSR or a step request triggered by setting DEMCR.MON_STEP to 1.

enumeratedValues.name: HALTED_0
enumeratedValues.description: No active halt request debug event

fields.name: BKPT
fields.description: Debug event generated by BKPT instruction execution or a breakpoint match in FPB

enumeratedValues.name: BKPT_1
enumeratedValues.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

fields.name: DWTTRAP
fields.description: Debug event generated by the DWT

enumeratedValues.name: DWTTRAP_0
enumeratedValues.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT

enumeratedValues.name: DWTTRAP_1
enumeratedValues.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

fields.name: VCATCH
fields.description: Indicates triggering of a Vector catch

fields.name: EXTERNAL
fields.description: Debug event generated because of the assertion of an external debug request

enumeratedValues.name: EXTERNAL_0
enumeratedValues.description: No external debug request debug event

fields.name: ADDRESS
fields.description: Address of MemManage fault location

fields.name: ADDRESS
fields.description: Address of the BusFault location

fields.name: STATE0
fields.description: ARM instruction set support

enumeratedValues.name: STATE0_3
enumeratedValues.description: Support for Thumb encoding including Thumb-2 technology, with all basic 16-bit and 32-bit instructions.

fields.name: STATE1
fields.description: Thumb instruction set support

enumeratedValues.name: STATE1_0
enumeratedValues.description: The processor does not support the ARM instruction set.

fields.name: STATE2
fields.description: ARMv7-M unused

fields.name: STATE3
fields.description: ARMv7-M unused

fields.name: PROGMODEL
fields.description: M profile programmers' model

fields.name: DEBUGMODEL
fields.description: Support for memory-mapped debug model for M profile processors

enumeratedValues.name: DEBUGMODEL_1
enumeratedValues.description: Support for M profile Debug architecture, with memory-mapped access.

fields.name: IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED0
fields.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

fields.name: IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED1
fields.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

fields.name: IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED2
fields.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

fields.name: IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED3
fields.description: Gives information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of a processor implementation.

fields.name: PMSASUPPORT
fields.description: Indicates support for a PMSA

enumeratedValues.name: PMSASUPPORT_3
enumeratedValues.description: PMSAv7, providing support for a base region and subregions.

fields.name: OUTERMOST_SHAREABILITY
fields.description: Indicates the outermost shareability domain implemented

fields.name: SHAREABILITY_LEVELS
fields.description: Indicates the number of shareability levels implemented

fields.name: TCM_SUPPORT
fields.description: Indicates the support for Tightly Coupled Memory

enumeratedValues.name: TCM_SUPPORT_1
enumeratedValues.description: Tightly coupled memories implemented with IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED control.

fields.name: AUXILIARY_REGISTERS
fields.description: Indicates the support for Auxiliary registers

enumeratedValues.name: AUXILIARY_REGISTERS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Support for Auxiliary Control Register only.

fields.name: ID_MMFR1
fields.description: Gives information about the implemented memory model and memory management support.

fields.name: WFI_STALL
fields.description: Indicates the support for Wait For Interrupt (WFI) stalling

fields.name: ID_MMFR3
fields.description: Gives information about the implemented memory model and memory management support.

fields.name: BITCOUNT_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Bit Counting instructions

enumeratedValues.name: BITCOUNT_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the CLZ instruction

fields.name: BITFIELD_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported BitField instructions

enumeratedValues.name: BITFIELD_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the BFC, BFI, SBFX, and UBFX instructions

fields.name: CMPBRANCH_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported combined Compare and Branch instructions

enumeratedValues.name: CMPBRANCH_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the CBNZ and CBZ instructions

fields.name: COPROC_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Coprocessor instructions

enumeratedValues.name: COPROC_INSTRS_0
enumeratedValues.description: None supported, except for separately attributed architectures, for example the Floating-point extension

enumeratedValues.name: COPROC_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for generic CDP, LDC, MCR, MRC, and STC instructions

enumeratedValues.name: COPROC_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for generic CDP2, LDC2, MCR2, MRC2, and STC2 instructions

enumeratedValues.name: COPROC_INSTRS_3
enumeratedValues.description: As for 2, and adds support for generic MCRR and MRRC instructions

enumeratedValues.name: COPROC_INSTRS_4
enumeratedValues.description: As for 3, and adds support for generic MCRR2 and MRRC2 instructions

fields.name: DEBUG_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Debug instructions

enumeratedValues.name: DEBUG_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the BKPT instruction

fields.name: DIVIDE_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Divide instructions

enumeratedValues.name: DIVIDE_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the SDIV and UDIV instructions

fields.name: EXTEND_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Extend instructions

enumeratedValues.name: EXTEND_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the SXTB, SXTH, UXTB, and UXTH instructions

enumeratedValues.name: EXTEND_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the SXTAB, SXTAB16, SXTAH, SXTB16, UXTAB, UXTAB16, UXTAH, and UXTB16 instructions

fields.name: IFTHEN_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported IfThen instructions

enumeratedValues.name: IFTHEN_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the IT instructions, and for the IT bits in the PSRs

fields.name: IMMEDIATE_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the support for data-processing instructions with long immediate

enumeratedValues.name: IMMEDIATE_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the ADDW, MOVW, MOVT, and SUBW instructions

fields.name: INTERWORK_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Interworking instructions

enumeratedValues.name: INTERWORK_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the BX instruction, and the T bit in the PSR

enumeratedValues.name: INTERWORK_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the BLX instruction, and PC loads have BX-like behavior

fields.name: LOADSTORE_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported additional load and store instructions

enumeratedValues.name: LOADSTORE_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the LDRD and STRD instructions

fields.name: MEMHINT_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Memory Hint instructions

enumeratedValues.name: MEMHINT_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the PLD instruction, ARMv7-M unused.

enumeratedValues.name: MEMHINT_INSTRS_3
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1 or 2, and adds support for the PLI instruction.

fields.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the support for multi-access interruptible instructions

enumeratedValues.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS_0
enumeratedValues.description: None supported. This means the LDM and STM instructions are not interruptible. ARMv7-M unused.

enumeratedValues.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: LDM and STM instructions are restartable.

enumeratedValues.name: MULTIACCESSINT_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: LDM and STM instructions are continuable.

fields.name: MULT_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported additional Multiply instructions

enumeratedValues.name: MULT_INSTRS_0
enumeratedValues.description: None supported. This means only MUL is supported. ARMv7-M unused.

enumeratedValues.name: MULT_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the MLA instruction, ARMv7-M unused.

enumeratedValues.name: MULT_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the MLS instruction.

fields.name: MULTS_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported advanced signed Multiply instructions

enumeratedValues.name: MULTS_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the SMULL and SMLAL instructions

enumeratedValues.name: MULTS_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the SMLABB, SMLABT, SMLALBB, SMLALBT, SMLALTB, SMLALTT, SMLATB, SMLATT, SMLAWB, SMLAWT, SMULBB, SMULBT, SMULTB, SMULTT, SMULWB, and SMULWT instructions.

enumeratedValues.name: MULTS_INSTRS_3
enumeratedValues.description: As for 2, and adds support for the SMLAD, SMLADX, SMLALD, SMLALDX, SMLSD, SMLSDX, SMLSLD, SMLSLDX, SMMLA, SMMLAR, SMMLS, SMMLSR, SMMUL, SMMULR, SMUAD, SMUADX, SMUSD, and SMUSDX instructions.

fields.name: MULTU_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported advanced unsigned Multiply instructions

enumeratedValues.name: MULTU_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the UMULL and UMLAL instructions.

enumeratedValues.name: MULTU_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the UMAAL instruction.

fields.name: REVERSAL_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Reversal instructions

enumeratedValues.name: REVERSAL_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the REV, REV16, and REVSH instructions, ARMv7-M unused.

enumeratedValues.name: REVERSAL_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the RBIT instruction.

fields.name: SATURATE_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Saturate instructions

enumeratedValues.name: SATURATE_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the QADD, QDADD, QDSUB, and QSUB instructions, and for the Q bit in the PSRs.

fields.name: SIMD_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported SIMD instructions

enumeratedValues.name: SIMD_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the SSAT and USAT instructions, and for the Q bit in the PSRs.

enumeratedValues.name: SIMD_INSTRS_3
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the PKHBT, PKHTB, QADD16, QADD8, QASX, QSUB16, QSUB8, QSAX, SADD16, SADD8, SASX, SEL, SHADD16, SHADD8, SHASX, SHSUB16, SHSUB8, SHSAX, SSAT16, SSUB16, SSUB8, SSAX, SXTAB16, SXTB16, UADD16, UADD8, UASX, UHADD16, UHADD8, UHASX, UHSUB16, UHSUB8, UHSAX, UQADD16, UQADD8, UQASX, UQSUB16, UQSUB8, UQSAX, USAD8, USADA8, USAT16, USUB16, USUB8, USAX, UXTAB16, and UXTB16 instructions. Also adds support for the GE[3:0] bits in the PSRs.

fields.name: SVC_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported SVC instructions

enumeratedValues.name: SVC_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the SVC instruction.

fields.name: SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS
fields.description: Together with the ID_ISAR4[SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS_FRAC] indicates the supported Synchronization Primitives

fields.name: TABBRANCH_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Table Branch instructions

enumeratedValues.name: TABBRANCH_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the TBB and TBH instructions.

fields.name: THUMBCOPY_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported non flag-setting MOV instructions

enumeratedValues.name: THUMBCOPY_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for encoding T1 of the MOV (register) instruction copying from a low register to a low register.

fields.name: TRUENOP_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported non flag-setting MOV instructions

enumeratedValues.name: TRUENOP_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for encoding T1 of the MOV (register) instruction copying from a low register to a low register.

fields.name: UNPRIV_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported unprivileged instructions. These are the instruction variants indicated by a T suffix.

enumeratedValues.name: UNPRIV_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the LDRBT, LDRT, STRBT, and STRT instructions.

enumeratedValues.name: UNPRIV_INSTRS_2
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for the LDRHT, LDRSBT, LDRSHT, and STRHT instructions.

fields.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the support for instructions with shifts

enumeratedValues.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS_0
enumeratedValues.description: Nonzero shifts supported only in MOV and shift instructions.

enumeratedValues.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for shifts of loads and stores over the range LSL 0-3.

enumeratedValues.name: WITHSHIFTS_INSTRS_3
enumeratedValues.description: As for 1, and adds support for other constant shift options, on loads, stores, and other instructions.

fields.name: WRITEBACK_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the support for Writeback addressing modes

enumeratedValues.name: WRITEBACK_INSTRS_0
enumeratedValues.description: Basic support. Only the LDM, STM, PUSH, and POP instructions support writeback addressing modes. ARMv7-M unused.

enumeratedValues.name: WRITEBACK_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for all of the writeback addressing modes defined in the ARMv7-M architecture.

fields.name: BARRIER_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported Barrier instructions

enumeratedValues.name: BARRIER_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the DMB, DSB, and ISB barrier instructions.

fields.name: SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS_FRAC
fields.description: Together with the ID_ISAR3[SYNCHPRIM_INSTRS] indicates the supported Synchronization Primitives

fields.name: PSR_M_INSTRS
fields.description: Indicates the supported M profile instructions to modify the PSRs

enumeratedValues.name: PSR_M_INSTRS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Adds support for the M-profile forms of the CPS, MRS, and MSR instructions, to access the PSRs.

fields.name: CL1
fields.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 1.

fields.name: CL2
fields.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 2.

fields.name: CL3
fields.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 3.

fields.name: CL4
fields.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 4.

fields.name: CL5
fields.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 5.

fields.name: CL6
fields.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 6.

fields.name: CL7
fields.description: Indicate the type of cache implemented at level 7.

fields.name: LOUIS
fields.description: Level of Unification Inner Shareable for the cache hierarchy. This field is RAZ.

fields.name: LOC
fields.description: Level of Coherency for the cache hierarchy

fields.name: LOU
fields.description: Level of Unification for the cache hierarchy

fields.name: IMINLINE
fields.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the instruction caches that are controlled by the processor.

fields.name: DMINLINE
fields.description: Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the data caches and unified caches that are controlled by the processor.

fields.name: ERG
fields.description: Exclusives Reservation Granule. The maximum size of the reservation granule that has been implemented for the Load-Exclusive and Store-Exclusive instructions, encoded as Log2 of the number of words.

fields.name: CWG
fields.description: Cache Write-back Granule. The maximum size of memory that can be overwritten as a result of the eviction of a cache entry that has had a memory location in it modified, encoded as Log2 of the number of words.

fields.name: FORMAT
fields.description: Indicates the implemented CTR format.

fields.name: LINESIZE
fields.description: (Log2(Number of words in cache line)) - 2.

fields.name: ASSOCIATIVITY
fields.description: (Associativity of cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates an associativity of 1. The associativity does not have to be a power of 2.

fields.name: NUMSETS
fields.description: (Number of sets in cache) - 1, therefore a value of 0 indicates 1 set in the cache. The number of sets does not have to be a power of 2.

fields.name: WA
fields.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-allocation

fields.name: RA
fields.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports read-allocation

fields.name: WB
fields.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-back

fields.name: WT
fields.description: Indicates whether the cache level supports write-through

fields.name: IND
fields.description: Instruction not data bit

fields.name: LEVEL
fields.description: Cache level of required cache

fields.name: CP0
fields.description: Access privileges for coprocessor 0.

enumeratedValues.name: CP0_0
enumeratedValues.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault.

enumeratedValues.name: CP0_1
enumeratedValues.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP UsageFault.

registers.name: STIR
registers.description: Instruction cache invalidate all to Point of Unification (PoU)

fields.name: INTID
fields.description: Indicates the interrupt to be triggered

registers.name: ICIALLU
registers.description: Instruction cache invalidate all to Point of Unification (PoU)

fields.name: ICIALLU
fields.description: I-cache invalidate all to PoU

registers.name: ICIMVAU
registers.description: Instruction cache invalidate by address to PoU

fields.name: ICIMVAU
fields.description: I-cache invalidate by MVA to PoU

registers.name: DCIMVAC
registers.description: Data cache invalidate by address to Point of Coherency (PoC)

fields.name: DCIMVAC
fields.description: D-cache invalidate by MVA to PoC

fields.name: DCISW
fields.description: D-cache invalidate by set-way

registers.name: DCCMVAU
registers.description: Data cache by address to PoU

fields.name: DCCMVAU
fields.description: D-cache clean by MVA to PoU

registers.name: DCCMVAC
registers.description: Data cache clean by address to PoC

fields.name: DCCMVAC
fields.description: D-cache clean by MVA to PoC

fields.name: DCCSW
fields.description: D-cache clean by set-way

registers.name: DCCIMVAC
registers.description: Data cache clean and invalidate by address to PoC

fields.name: DCCIMVAC
fields.description: D-cache clean and invalidate by MVA to PoC

registers.name: DCCISW
registers.description: Data cache clean and invalidate by set/way

fields.name: DCCISW
fields.description: D-cache clean and invalidate by set-way

fields.name: EN
fields.description: TCM enable. When a TCM is disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.

fields.name: RMW
fields.description: Read-Modify-Write (RMW) enable. Indicates that all writes to TCM, that are not the full width of the TCM RAM, use a RMW sequence.

fields.name: RETEN
fields.description: Retry phase enable. When enabled the processor guarantees to honor the retry output on the corresponding TCM interface, re-executing the instruction which carried out the TCM access.

fields.name: SZ
fields.description: TCM size. Indicates the size of the relevant TCM.

fields.name: EN
fields.description: TCM enable. When a TCM is disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.

fields.name: RMW
fields.description: Read-Modify-Write (RMW) enable. Indicates that all writes to TCM, that are not the full width of the TCM RAM, use a RMW sequence.

fields.name: RETEN
fields.description: Retry phase enable. When enabled the processor guarantees to honor the retry output on the corresponding TCM interface, re-executing the instruction which carried out the TCM access.

fields.name: SZ
fields.description: TCM size. Indicates the size of the relevant TCM.

fields.name: EN
fields.description: AHBP enable.

enumeratedValues.name: EN_0
enumeratedValues.description: AHBP disabled. When disabled all accesses are made to the AXIM interface.

fields.name: SZ
fields.description: AHBP size.

fields.name: SIWT
fields.description: Shared cacheable-is-WT for data cache. Enables limited cache coherency usage.

enumeratedValues.name: SIWT_0
enumeratedValues.description: Normal Cacheable Shared locations are treated as being Non-cacheable. Default mode of operation for Shared memory.

enumeratedValues.name: SIWT_1
enumeratedValues.description: Normal Cacheable shared locations are treated as Write-Through.

fields.name: ECCDIS
fields.description: Enables ECC in the instruction and data cache.

enumeratedValues.name: ECCDIS_0
enumeratedValues.description: Enables ECC in the instruction and data cache.

enumeratedValues.name: ECCDIS_1
enumeratedValues.description: Disables ECC in the instruction and data cache.

fields.name: FORCEWT
fields.description: Enables Force Write-Through in the data cache.

enumeratedValues.name: FORCEWT_1
enumeratedValues.description: Enables Force Write-Through. All Cacheable memory regions are treated as Write-Through.

fields.name: CTL
fields.description: AHBS prioritization control.

enumeratedValues.name: CTL_0
enumeratedValues.description: AHBS access priority demoted. This is the reset value.

enumeratedValues.name: CTL_2
enumeratedValues.description: AHBS access priority demoted by initializing the fairness counter to the CM7_AHBSCR[INITCOUNT] value when the software execution priority is higher than or equal to the threshold level programed in CM7_AHBSCR[TPRI].

enumeratedValues.name: CTL_3
enumeratedValues.description: AHBSPRI signal has control of access priority.

fields.name: TPRI
fields.description: Threshold execution priority for AHBS traffic demotion.

fields.name: INITCOUNT
fields.description: Fairness counter initialization value.

fields.name: ITCM
fields.description: Asynchronous fault on ITCM interface.

fields.name: DTCM
fields.description: Asynchronous fault on DTCM interface.

fields.name: AHBP
fields.description: Asynchronous fault on AHBP interface.

fields.name: AXIM
fields.description: Asynchronous fault on AXIM interface.

fields.name: EPPB
fields.description: Asynchronous fault on EPPB interface.

fields.name: AXIMTYPE
fields.description: Indicates the type of fault on the AXIM interface. Only valid when AXIM is 1.
